abstract: Researchers find that air pollution in India is causing people to lose an average of 3.2 years in life expectancy, at huge cost to country's economy.
lead_paragraph: Altogether, 660 million Indians could lose 2.1 billion years in life expectancy as a result of air pollution, at enormous cost to the country’s economy, researchers found.

headline.main: Polluted Air Cuts Years Off Lives of Millions in India, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Polluted Air Cuts Years Off Lives of Millions in India, Study Finds

snippet: Altogether, 660 million Indians could lose 2.1 billion years in life expectancy as a result of air pollution, at enormous cost to the country’s economy, researchers found.
